channel.title: Discovery channel messing up
channel.description:
Think about it... Deadliest Catch Sons of Guns Texas Car Wars Wild West Alaska Fast 'n' Loud Bering Sea Gold Gold Rush Amish Mafia
Discovery channel isn't about science anymore nowadays... They're just bringing out shows about people who have a job/company around 1 'badass' thing that would fascinate the redneck american but the shows don't really contain anything scientific anymore... They have some nice shows such as Man vs Wild, Dirty Jobs, How do they do it?, etc... but the majority of the shows are just... useless. I used to enjoy the old Discovery Channel where I could put it on and watch randomcrazy science shit I know nothing about and you know what? They made it seem interesting to watch and learn. Now it's all about fat old men who show their asscrack on TV as they're getting either an engine running or yelling at eachother about somthing regarding their job. What do you think?

item.title: Discovery channel messing up
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

Did you guys not read what I posted? Majority of the science related shows have gone over to the Science Channel, which is a branch of the Discovery Channel. With How It’s Made on the subject, it is also on the Science Channel.

http://science.discovery.com/tv-shows/how-its-made

If you wish to see all the shows on that channel, here you go:

Science

Science - Official Site

Official Homepage for Science. Watch Full Episodes FREE with your TV subscription. Get Behind the Scenes with Your Favorite Shows! Start Exploring Now!

Read full topic

item.title: Discovery channel messing up
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:13, topic:519614”]Discovery is about nature and science, I think you’ll find most of those fit into those categories. But yea, it’s becoming a lot more about drama mixed with them than just science.

Mythbusters ftw :p[/quote]
True and I agree, that show is another one of those exceptions
Some of the shows don’t have anything relating to nature or science btw…
Wheeler Dealers
Chasing Classic Cars
American Chopper - Senior vs Junior
Auction Kings…

Read full topic

item.title: Discovery channel messing up
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

[quote=“Mikeyzzz, post:11, topic:519614”][quote author=xxx123xxx link=topic=638079.msg4303503#msg4303503 date=1369387219]
It’s all bout how its made, I could watch that show for days.
[/quote]this.[/quote]
That’s actually the only show that seems to be about science on that channel.
It’s the others that annoy me… I don’t give 2 anally fucked shits about how those people make their money.

item.title: Discovery channel messing up
item.dc:creator: @3lv3n_snip3r 3lv3n snip3r
item.description:
@3lv3n_snip3r wrote:

[quote=“Rash, post:8, topic:519614”][quote author=RiiPiiNFtW link=topic=638079.msg4302072#msg4302072 date=1369169374]

Man vs Wild is a terrible show.
[/quote]They don’t even do that anymore. And it was amazing. It might of been staged, but Bear Grylls definitely knows his shit.

They only reason they’re doing these types of shows is because they’re competing with NatGeo.

Stuart pls. It’s an idiotic show.[/quote]
People watched it and that’s all that really matters.

TLC (former acronym for The Learning Channel) is an American cable TV specialty channel owned by Discovery Communications. The channel was founded in 1972 by the Department of Health, Education, and Welfare and NASA.
